news.title: Watch Wet Leg’s Video for New Song “CPR”
news.summary: Another new preview of sophomore album Moisturizer

news.title: Modest Mouse Announce Tour With Built to Spill
news.summary: The band’s massive 2025 itinerary, including a tour with Flaming Lips, gets an autumn add-on

news.title: Mavi and Earl Sweatshirt Share Video for New Song “Landgrab”: Watch
news.summary: “Earl was the first person to bring me out in a collaborative way,” Mavi told Pitchfork, “I want him to accompany me through that door as he did before”

news.title: Dry Cleaning Announce 2025 U.S. Concerts
news.summary: The London post-punkers have added headline dates in Cleveland, Milwaukee, and Brooklyn to their shows supporting Godspeed You! Black Emperor

news.title: Wednesday, They Are Gutting a Body of Water, and More: This Week’s Pitchfork Selects Playlist
news.summary: Our weekly playlist highlights songs that our writers, editors, and contributors are listening to on repeat

news.title: Grizzly Bear Announce First North American Tour Since 2019
news.summary: The indie-rock band will return to the stage in the autumn

news.title: Lucrecia Dalt Announces New Album A Danger to Ourselves, Shares Video: Watch
news.summary: “Divina” leads the ¡Ay! follow-up, which is co-produced by David Sylvian

news.title: Pitchfork and Them Announce 2025 Night Out Pride Celebration and Concert
news.summary: Underscores, Dua Saleh, Skaiwater, and Bushwig DJ will play the Pride event at Knockdown Center in June

news.title: Pitchfork Music Festival London 2025 Adds Second Wave of Artists
news.summary: Destroyer, Saul Williams & Carlos Niño, Los Thuthanaka, Ali Sethi & Nicolás Jaar, Marie Davidson, Nala Sinephro, Tunde Adebimpe, and more join the bill

news.title: Watch Janet Jackson Perform Medley, Accept Icon Award at the 2025 American Music Awards
news.summary: She broke out “Someone to Call My Lover” and “All for You” for her first TV performance in seven years
